706977f-a.text:
Surf Ave., east from Stillwell Ave. to West 5th Street, showing a principal street in Coney Island on a summer day. The Brooklyn Trust Company, a branch bank, and Feltman's Restaurant are visible at the right; across the street from there is the entrance to Luna Park, in the background
is a portion of Seaside Park.
About 1931.
Ewing Galloway.

706982f-a.text:
Surf Ave., eaat,from stillwell Ave., ahowing in the left foreground at the N.W. corner, Loew's Coney Island Theatre, beyond which is the entrance to Luna Park. Note the crowds and cars that are always found in Coney Island on
summer weekends .
About 1925.
Ewing Galloway

tmnks.
October 1928.

Stillwell Ave., north from Coney lIsland (Reigelmann) Boardwalk to Surf Ave., showing demolition in progress for the extension d this Ave.,

(2)
The samme, slightly northward.

A view north of the Bowery. On the right appears Stratton Walk,
which will become a part of this new thoroughfare.
December 1923.

(4)
The same as No. 1, at a later date, and showing the new Avenne.
Novemke 1924.

706974f-c.text:
(1)
Surf Ave., south side, between Stillwell Ave., and Stratton Henderson Walk. Stratton Walk which ran north and southwards narall: 1 to Henderson's Restaurant, is now (1929)3tillwell Ave. This view shows a portion of the Henderson estaurant site being utilized for the widening and opening of Stillwell Ave. The building at the right, was
Shafer's Hotel in 1883.
DDecember 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, a further view.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, another view.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(4)
The same, showing the modernized Henderson Restaurant and Stillwell
Ave., completed.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
